name: Amy Raab
text: We love Morris youth association

name: Virginia Dickey
text: Nice sports complex. Has both football and baseball fields. Concessions, restrooms, batting cages.

name: janice wester
text: Nice ballpark, very well kept up.  Plenty of room to "spread out"!

name: Dorothy Sloan
text: Had to go register our boys team for the tournament. Great handouts located inside

name: Yvonne Kimbrough
text: Great place to relax and enjoy your family..

name: Timothy D
text: Me and the kids had a ball of fun

name: wes Coy
text: Nice

name: Jonathan Kimbrough
text: Like it

name: Shanika Ogburn
text:
This church is truly awesome! I felt the Holy Spirit the moment I stepped in. I heard of the church after enrolling my daughter in their summer camp and private school. I'm so excited for her to be a part of the school where God and academia are both very important. I was thrilled to see that what I saw in the church is the same thing I saw in the school. The people are loving and welcoming, and aren't afraid to show their love for God. If you visit this church feeling heavy and leave the same way, you missed something! I know because I moved here to Alabama at the worst time of my life and I felt encouragement and the joy of God just from two visits. Try it for yourself! I'll definitely be returning.
Also, they have children's church!

name: Janet Faustmann
text: The Pastors of this church truly love God and love people. They teach the Bible. The true word of God.   The Pastors and members here   care for each other and care for the local community.  That love, care, and sharing of Jesus is also carried into other countries of the world.    My family and I are truly blessed to be a part of this church.

name: Sandra Webber
text: I have been a member since 2012.  If you want to learn more about getting closer to God, come here.  The music is fantastic and the pastors are great.  They teach things that you can relate to and definitely apply to your every day life.

name: Sammie Laster
text: The pillars of Worshipping Jesus and Declaring His Word (over your own life as well as the lives of others) is foundational here.  If you want the "Good Food" of God's Word while enjoying His Presence....come visit AND stay!

name: Samantha Bagwell
text: If you want to hear the true word of God, look no further. If you want to be among believers who love God, look no further. This is a great church and a great family.

name: Jennifer Berisford
text: We love the genuine heart of the pastors as well as the involvement in local and world missions.   Fantastic children's miniseries, and freedom to choose from multiple small groups of all kinds.

name: Diana Hase
text: Valley is not just a great church.  It's our family!  Come worship with us and experience the tangible transforming love of Jesus,  the manifest presence of the Holy Spirit bringing peace and healing, the power of God the  Father sustaining  and keeping us and giving hope .

name: Heather Killinger
text: Valley Fellowship has been a blessing to my family. It's a safe place for families to go to share their lives together. I would absolutely recommend to all of my friends.

name: Amanda Woodson
text: Come be a part of a church that welcomes you like family. With a heart for missions, Christian Education and a love for people, Valley Fellowship is a true blessing to Huntsville Alabama.

name: Emerson Bradley
text: Someone had told us about Valley Fellowship Church so we went to visit.  It was like a light had been turned on.  We had never seen worship like that before and the prayer and ministry was just amazing.

name: Bernadette Thomas
text: I've been coming here for decades, even before the current pastor was there, but I joined the night that I first heard them preach there. They were so good I wanted to be a permanent part of that.

name: Sam Hobsin
text: I love the ministry here. It speaks right to me and hits on a personal level.

name: Harry Ronstead
text: I have been attending Valley Fellowship Church for about 9 years now.  They have excellent ministry to meet individual needs of others.  I would highly recommend them to friends and family, and have.

name: Margaret Peters
text: You cannot find a pastor with more integrity. This place just has something special about it that I love.

name: Wesley Church
text: There's a great group of people at Valley Fellowship! Great praise and worship

name: Cara Goodwin
text: Valley Fellowship Church has been my home church for the last 29 years.  I have found family here that has nothing to do with blood.  We have lived here together, through weddings, births, funerals and everything in between.

name: Alison Harvey
text: They truly care about salvation. They want people to live with God in all ways.

name: Chris Brown
text: Valley Fellowship Church is closer than family to me!

name: Paula Watkins
text: They take great care of my granddaughter

name: Devin Nobles
text: Good place for kids to learn and build friendships.

name: family 1st.
text: Nice place for teens and young kids to learn play and stay out of trouble.

name: Ashley Jay
text: Had to vote here the environment was good and quiet

name: Shari Little
text: Take good care of our kids.

name: Dewayne Campbell
text: Great place to go

name: Felecia Wilson
text: Great place for kids.

name: adrienne miller
text: Cute place

name: Rodney Brasley
text: It is close to my house.

name: Ernestl Moses
text: This is my voting precinct

name: Wendy B
text: I was almost employed here and though I ended up accepting a position elsewhere & never actually worked there, I admire and respect what they are doing for children. They are a tremendous asset to the community and they do not allow just anyone around their children. The background check is extensive. They are very serious about their childrens' safety and well being and I could really tell. They don't just house them either, they are teaching them to be responsible & respectful and nurturing all of them separately and according to their specific needs. The grounds, bedrooms, bathroom, eating areas, living areas, etc. are all very well kept. I hope they keep up the good work and continue to receive the funding they need to keep helping children in need.

name: Smile and Shine
text: This place is wonderful and full of love. It's good to know people really do care for others and may many more blessings come their way. The staff is nice and treat the kids just like their own.The children are very respectful and loving too. I will continue to help them by doing my part. Special thanks to East End Baptist Church,  AOH Church of God,  Titusville and UAB Kirkland Clinic Nuclear Cardiology Department for helping me with VBS2018 in giving support to a charity I've grown to love so much.

name: Brandon Cook
text: Lived there from age 9 to 20 loved it...

name: cool_turtle54
text: Best place ever

name: Jessica Staples
text: The Boys & Girls Club is an amazing place for kids in this community to come. Everyone is so helpful and you can tell that they thoroughly enjoy changing the lives of these young people!

name: R. Smith
text: Joined the YMCA because state employees get a discount and I wanted to get back into a gym routine. It’s very close to my work so I go on my lunch breaks three days a week. The layout is somewhat odd, but they have a lot to offer as far as equipment ... unfortunately for me, I went I UAB and was spoiled by the facilities there, with that being said, I’ve been going for about 6-weeks and have enjoyed the exercise and break in my day

name: Titus Young
text: Loving family atmosphere

name: Lel Dale
text: The kids are happy here & I'm well pleased to know they are care for in a homelike environment! Thank all of you for all you do...You all are appreciated!

name: ELW
text: My children enjoy the club. They are teaching good values and offer homework help. The meals are nutritious. They expose the children to cultural events.

name: Vanessa Fields
text: It's a good reasonable price and safe place for after school care. They also have a summer camp.

name: Patricia Williams
text: Good summer activities for youngsters

name: victoria cawthon
text: love it!!! my son enjoys his time there!!

name: LAND HARRINGTON
text: Keeps the kids active

name: Lashay Tingz
text: Not good food quality was too much like school

name: Thomas Anderson
text: Very good Y employees, friendly and treat everyone like friends. Nice, comfortable setup.

name: Epc Maxx
text: 1 star only cause  couldnt give a zero, horrible rude  staff no machines impossible to find

name: Jia Gill
text: Closes before time and the employees are rude. Should be opened now, employee sitting out front once ride pulled up and location closed.

name: Johnny Blackmon
text: Clean, professional and friendly staff

name: Tim
text: Beautiful place with friendly staff and clean facilities.

name: Pamela Pruett
text: I have hosted 4 retreats here. The staff is always pleasent, helpful and very nice. They have always gone out of their way to make sure we have everything we needed. I will always be back.

name: Ryan DeWitte
text: I was there for Teenpact and the camp was great. Well built and well laid out. 5/5

name: lori Syck
text: Camp Chandler was an awesome team building experience! I  can't thank the staff enough!

name: caroline
text: My daughter went for her first year this past week, and she loved it! She said the food was good, the activities were fun, the staff was nice, and she over all had a wonderful time! Definitely coming back another year!

name: Doris Mickey Perry
text: Grand daughter absolutely LOVED her overnite camping. Sweet old fashion woodsy environment. Lots of fun well supervised activities. Up dated bath houses. Good food. Wonderful experienced staff.

name: Atlanta Acne Specialists
text: My son has gone to Camp Chandler for 5 years and has a blast every time. I’m sad this was his last year as a camper. I hope he takes advantage of becoming a counselor. I highly recommend this camp. For the value it’s worth every penny.

name: Jessica Joyner
text: My daughter loves Camp Chandler! I as a parent, love the structured activities provided. I also love how the counselors are so active with the children and you can tell that they love their job.

name: Shari Threadgill
text: OVERALL GREAT EXPERIENCE! MY 8 YEAR OLD LOVES GOING EVERYDAY AND LEARNS MORE AND MORE ABOUT THE OUTDOORS!

name: Zacc Gleason
text: Great camp, all bad reviews are from one group, they may have had a bad time, but the event and everyone associated with the event loved it. Great food and many fun places to play games

name: Eric Jacks
text: My son and I had a great weekend at Camp Chandler. We shared a cabin with two of my son's friends and their dads. The food was great. The many activities were fun and plenty of time was alotted for every father and his child(ren) to enjoy each activity. We will be back the next time this event is offered.

name: Ashley Aaltonen
text: Everything about summer camp is amazing! Both kids 9 & 15 absolutely LOVED it there. 15 y/o ssai she didn't care about not having her phone at all. She'd rather give it up and stay at camp forever. They enjoyed horseback riding, banana boat, rifleing, kayaking, cabin activities, and so much more. Everyone was so nice, and they really invested a lot in these kids. This program is more than I could have ever hoped for. I literally would not change a thing! If your kids are looking for a fun filled adventure, you must send them here.

name: Rachel Thomas
text: 1992 was the last year i was there, i love it because it got me away from home for a week with no drama. I would definitely love to see how the place looks now nearly 30 years later. I hope you're still giving out free weeks at the camp for the underprivileged kids too i know i was one of them i even got to go Twice in one summer, the teachers felt that bad for me...thanx again for the generosity!

name: Amber Carpenter
text: Decent place but terrible, racist staff and the whole place got infested with bed bugs. My last trip as a senior was cut short a whole day.

name: Kerri hensarling
text: My boys talk about and look forward to camp all year long!!!  My 5th grader has completed his 6th summer with Camp Chandler and talks about becoming a counselor one day.

name: Sarah Williams
text: we went here for a retreat and there were bed bugs and had racist staff. i wish there was a place to have 0 stars. would not recommend

name: Tiffany McGhee
text: Nice place but communication is terrible! They barely answer the phone or respond to emails, and that’s unprofessional.

name: sophia willingham
text: it’s a nice location but there were racist staff and my entire youth group got bedbugs and had to leave our retreat early.

name: Lauralee Farmer
text: Some people working there were racist and my whole yg got bed bugs and we had to leave early and our retreat got ruined.

name: Katie Fain
text: The staff was racist, and my youth group got bed bugs so we had to leave early which is unfair and all their fault

name: DeeDee Davis
text: Amazing!!

name: venus9 Cotton
text: Professional and good customer service

name: Lashawna Hollis
text: If you are looking for a great place for after school care, Virtual Learning, and service during the summer this is the place

name: Ky Marie
text: Absolutely Love Goodtimes!! We use them for several of their programs like before and after school child care, days out camp during the school year. The kids also attend summer camp and I can not Express how Grateful we are for all of the counselors and staff that make these different programs happen!! Would definitely recommend this place to anyone who needs childcare throughout the year!!

name: Shannon Montgomery
text: We love the YMCA Goodtimes program!  This is my daughter's 7th year participating, and she has had very positive experiences.  Ms. Sonja Williams at Forest Avenue Magnet and Coach Moore at Baldwin Magnet are awesome.  They truly care about the students, ensure that their homework is completed, and provide them with healthy and fun recreational activities.  My daughter has also made many good friends at Goodtimes.  We are truly grateful for the program and the wonderful people who oversee it.  Thanks for everything!

name: Diana Harris
text: My child enjoyed the summer program and the staff was very professional. Great place to send your child.

name: jinkuk choi
text: I think management or just manager was changed. My son had ymca learning program at this time for online class due to c19. Last week was horrible. I sent zoom meeting information with teacher email on Tue which is saying that she would need class in zoom meeting at first week. Manager replied she needs schoology log in info. I had to reply again on Wed morning that my son needed to attend zoom meeting instead of schoology. But he missed Wed. I sent email again that let him attend on Thur & Fri finally. On Thur, my son missed again. So during meeting, I called manager to check it out. She did not know it. Finally on Fri. my son attended fully. So my son was not happy and comfortable with YMCA service. Me neither. Without care, I paid $120 each week. My son told me his elder sister could help him instead of YMCA. So this week Mon, as soon as my son dropped in YMCA, I sent email to manager that I need to cancel. She replied she saw my son and asked me about changing my mind. I replied immediately that I would want to cancel asap your confirmation. She replied at 11oclock that she cancelled from next week. So I called her and asked her that I wanted to cancel this week and get refund. She said that even one day attendance would change all week payment. So she won't give refund no matter one day attendance of my son. It does not make sense at all. YMCA is very greedy. Even I sent her email at 8clock at Monday morning. I sent email to manager and cc to director. But the same reply. Very greedy. I am still very mad at this.

name: Qurat Habib
text: I have been very satisfied with goodtimes YMCA. I have been with them for over a year now. This year they have improved a lot. They help them finish the homework and provide healthy snacks. My kids are happy when I pick them up.

name: Latonya Williams
text: My daughter loves the afterschool program. The workers are great and help assist her with her homework. My daughter has met alot of new friends and loves engaging in all the fun activities.

name: Alison Beach
text: We love the aftercare program at Good Times YMCA at St. Bede. Our kids have a great time with friends, get some of their homework done, and never want to come home!

name: Stephanie Scheffler
text: Great pool for both younger and older kids!

name: Lexi’s World
text: They have a waterpark and swimming lessons!!!!

name: Natividad Pascual-Andres
text: Not very welcoming! :( not friendly!

name: Lynda Stephenson
text: Bad picture plz put a new one

name: Wil Bowman
text: One of the best equipped YMCA gyms that I have been to. Nice equipment, plenty of iron, plenty of bumper plates, a bunch of racks and benches.  Some higher-end equipment as well. The locker room is a dump, but it's not a priority for me.

name: Myra Mason
text: I love my YMCA! Its always clean and the employees are super nice! They just put in lots of new equipment.

name: Kevin Preble
text: Super clean gym. State of the art equipment and plenty of it. Super friendly staff. Oh and the lap pool is awesome.

name: Dawn Steadham
text: Love my Y!

name: Robin Bolen
text: You couldn’t ask for a better after school and summer care. From Carmen the director all the way to each individual counselor. My kids have been here going on three years. I can not explain the amount of love my kids are giving and how willing they are to work with my youngest when it comes to meds and helping to make a plan that works best for him. Carmen, Ashley, Taylor ,and  Ely have also became more like family. I know my kids are safe and taken care of anytime their at the Y.

name: sydney howard
text:
NOT SAFE for BABIES. Daycare let my BABY get TRAMPLED by older kids running around and another time didn’t strap my baby in and he was standing up in a stationary seat about to fall and smack head on a cabinet. Worst daycare staff ever!
Very nice facility if you do not have kids though.

name: Danny Thomas
text: I just joined. It’s not newer like planet fitness, but I love it. A place for the kids while you working out. Very nice staff..

name: Mallory Anderson
text: My family loves the North Mobile Y! We've used them for 3yrs now, no complaints, staff is amazing ❤️

name: Candise Smith
text: Need to have a bigger facility with more machines so there is no wait. The kids over the pool area are extremely sarcastic and rude with a very false sense of entitlement. The children's center across the way seems to be a place for troubled kids. My kids will never attend there again. Always a fight with a troubled child almost daily. Supervised by teens/young adults not at all ready for the responsibility of the well being of so many children. I quit my job so my kids did not have to be here everyday. Could not stand to see them beg me not to leave them everyday. No amount of money is worth leaving your babies with someone who doesn't care that they are changing your child on the inside for the worst.

name: Brian Keevan
text: All the equipment you need, free weights, cardio & a helpful staff. A+

name: Ron K. Mitchell
text: Great job Saraland YMCA. I love the new space, equipment, classes and the Christian Family atmosphere.

name: I’m Dirty Dan
text: This place is amazing.

name: JDware X
text: Its so trash

name: Anna Bryant
text: Clean, lots to choose from, nice folks working desk. Great prices too!

name: Rolf Snobeck
text: Great place to visit. I was surprised the first time i drove by here to see a rendition of the Statue of Liberty.  The adjacent park honors Eagle Scouts.  Beautiful area, worth a visit.

name: Mark Smith
text: Conveniently located in Liberty Park. Easy to get to and a good selection at the Scout Shop. Very impressive monument to Eagle Scouts.

name: Matt Jones
text: We've been here a few times to visit the boy Scout store for supplies, and it's well stocked, especially if you're looking for gift ideas for a scout leveling up etc. The eagle wall will soon have our eagle scout's name added to it, and we're really excited about that.

name: Lindi Pearson
text: Pack 95 of Homewood, Mt. Brook, and Vestavia rocks!!! My boys love it and parents love it. Great all around activity and group!!!

name: G Mack
text: Boy Scouts Troop 76 Vestavia Hills, Al should be charged with a hate crime.

name: Julie Nelson
text: The Greater Alabama Council, Boy Scouts of America, serves over 28,000 Scouts in 22 counties in Central and North Alabama.

name: Bonnie Turner
text: Great place, honoring Alabama Eagle Scouts

name: Ryan Jammy
text:
Why is it in the woods ?

I dont have a kid but If I did I wouldnt send them to the woods.

thank you

name: Devona Laipply
text: Last summer we placed our grandson in the boys and girls club. He enjoyed it so much.

name: Cindy Hudson
text: Love it!  My daughter loves it! She gets help with her homework and they feed the kids a meal after school.

name: Alex Ream
text: I have been a Trussville Y member for three years and still believe in the great value the Y membership has to offer. My only wish is extending evening hours for those who want to visit after work. But I understand the pandemic has affected the operations schedule quite a bit.

resp.text: We are pleased you have chosen the YMCA as your partner in Healthy Living and are committed to providing the best possible experience for you and your family.  We have extended our hours Monday-Thursday 5:00am-8:00pm, Friday 5:00am-7:00pm and Saturday 8:00am-5:00pm, Sunday 12:00pm-5:00pm.  Thank you so much for sharing your thoughts with us ! See you at the Y!!!!

name: Steven Baker
text: I love the equipment at the Y! The staff is awesome and helpful. Everyone is really friendly! I highly recommend the YMCA for getting yourself into shape.

name: John Rankin
text:
I've been going to the Trussville YMCA for about ten years.  The staff is consistently cordial, helpful, and very busy, working with a diverse gender-age membership with various needs and preferences for exercise.

I would like to see two or three more smith machines, as they allow typical basic weightlifting exercises without a partner to spot you. Especially helpful when flexibility, balance, and form are not what they used to be.

resp.text:
John,

Thank you for the comment.  We strive to provide excellent customer service at all times and sincerely appreciate you recognizing that effort.  We are also always looking for ways to improve and continue to make our members happy.  Thank you again for taking the time to provide feedback for our staff.

name: Delores Armstrong
text: I Love the Y @Trussville!!!  The staff is great, facility is clean and well managed.  The group classes are the best.  I especially enjoy the community engagement from the blood drives to the scholarships for those less fortunate.  The YMCA is a jewel in the Trussville community.

resp.text: Thank you Delores!  You are so sweet and we have really appreciated the time that you have volunteered to the Trussville Y!

name: George Barnett
text: The Trussville YMCA has foresight when it helps the area wide community with many needs. Families all over the region benefit from coat, food, and blood drives hosted at the Trussville YMCA. After school care for those who may not always be able to afford the cost. Welcoming place to exercise and be more healthy.

resp.text: Hi George!  Thank you for your kind words!  We have been truly blessed to have such wonderful members who have contributed to each of these causes and helped make our community stronger! - Dana

name: Kathleen Langsdale
text:
As an upcoming senior citizen, I love the fact the Trussville Y offers membership scholarships to those who are unable to join because of their income.  Helping seniors is so important to help keep us "wiser adults" active and live longer and healthier.
The Trussville YMCA is a wonderful place for fellowship, exercise and overall fun for all ages.  In today's world, where can you go that is totally a positive atmosphere where you can get all 3 advantages.  And if you are in any sort of need, the Trussville Y is there to help even if it is outside their realm  They are an awesome place to join and enjoy!!!!!
•	Provide a place for fellowship, exercise, and fun

resp.text: Thanks Kathleen!  We are so glad that you've had such great experiences at our branch!  If you want to make sure you have ALL of the most current information about what's going on at the Trussville YMCA, you can follow us on Facebook (Trussville YMCA) or swing by the Welcome Center to update your email address so you get our monthly newsletter!  We look forward to seeing you soon. - Dana

name: Daishaun Morgan
text: Clean facilities and friendly staff. We visit this location the most, I think because of the upkeep, equipment variety, indoor pool, and staff.

name: Vicki Stanford
text: Great place to improve mobility and physical stamina. The staff is friendly and helpful, and there is a program for everyone. I swim laps and am beginning physical training to improve balance and strength. I highly recommend.

resp.text: Thanks Vicki!  We are so happy to hear about your personal progress!  Thanks for being one of our AMAZING members!

name: Denise folkerts
text: The Trussville YMCA is an asset to this community.  The staff is friendly and cares about the mission.  Staff is constantly working to support community with education classes and other projects. Good Job!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Denise!  We love supporting the community making a difference in the lives of those around us!

name: Alonzo Taylor
text:
A new member was complaining in the men's locker room today about a smell coming out the steam Room in the  Men's locker ROOM😳😢 is  filthy !!!!!! And stays that way I've been complaining about this for months!!! me and several other members was talking about this problem today and we agree it's no use of complaining about it because nothing will get done. Steam room walls are BROWN with DIRT and BACTERIA !!!!😢 most of the time the hot tub it's not working properly  or it's cold !!!! It's a shame when you have to go other YMCAs to go to a CLEAN facility
for your membership. I never have this problem when I go to the other branches in town!!! Shades Valley, Hoover , Pelham SPOT LESS!! I always see people in Maintenance Cleaning the locker room except for the Trussville location !!😢 I have never in my LIFE been to a GYM so filthy and dirty just hope no one catches a staph infection!!! Very disappointed.

resp.text: Hi Alonzo!  Thank you for your message.  I am so sorry to hear that you have not had a great experience at the Trussville YMCA.  I would love for you to contact me so I can talk to you more about your concerns and to let you know about some of the improvements and updates that are coming!  - Dana Larkin (205) 655-2224

name: juan waggoner
text: Love the gym just wished equipment in child care was cleaned better. My kid ended up catching MRSA from the dirty play equipment.

resp.text: Hi Juan!  I see that you haven't visited our facility in quite some time, so I wanted to reach out and let you know that since your last visit, we have had a few changes in management.  We would love to help you get re-engaged with the facility and make sure that you have a fabulous experience!   We are sorry to hear about any negative experience you've had at the Trussville YMCA, but please feel free to reach out to me anytime with questions or concerns!  - Dana (205) 655-2224

name: Bryan Blackmon
text: The Y is an excellent place to let off some steam or get some steam, in the steam rooms. This is one of the very few locations in the Birmingham Metro area that has a swimming pool that is open year around and that is fantastic.

name: Brent Smith
text: Rude staff, especially the director. If you dont work for a living, they will give memberships away. However, those of us who go to work everyday and pay our bills; they charge out the nose.

resp.text: We apologize for your bad experience. We do offer financial assistance for a reduced rate. We would like to have an opportunity to change your mind about the Y.  Please contact Kim Ryals at KRyals@ymcabham.org

name: Josh Philliy
text: Everything is awesome, especially the staff. But I just wish we had another basketball court or something. Because I hate being kicked off the court for basketball and volleyball practice.

resp.text:
Thank you for the review.  We have the basketball and Volleyball practice schedule posted, sorry for the inconvenience.
YMCA- Trussville

name: Lillian Clemens
text: Love it best place to swim do activities during the summer and a good place to work out

resp.text: We are glad you love the Y!  Thanks, Wendy

name: Jacob Wallace
text: It would be great if they would activities like volleyball in other gym and not kick kids off the basketball court

resp.text: Thank you for your suggestion.

name: venqu v
text: Great place to work out and swim. Wish theyd update the basketball area

resp.text:
Thank you for the review. We are looking into improving the basketball area.  Currently we replacing the floor in the cardio room.
Thank you,
Wendy Newland

name: Scott Crawford
text: As Ys go, the Trussville YMCA is one of the better ones. Large cardio room; free weight room and weight machines; full range of cardio and cross training classes; upstairs track; full sized basketball court; racquetball courts; tennis courts; full size pool with smaller lap pool; and locker rooms with steam room, whirl pool, and showers. The staff is courteous and maintain the gym well.

resp.text: Scott - Thank you for sharing! We are so happy to hear you are enjoying your experience being a member of the Y! We look forward to continuing to serve you.

name: Sam A
text: A. Safe place my boys can go to  for workout activities when there's no school or no after school activities

name: Linda Henry-Jones
text: The workers are very helpful and friendly

name: nicole Lockhart
text: It is a amazing place

resp.text: Nicole, thank you for sharing your love for the Trussville Y!

name: Laura Brooks
text: Awesome! Everyone there is so kind and caring.  My children love going there.  The past 5 years have been wonderful!

name: Ashley Bates
text: Do not send your child here. They don't pay attention to the children. My daughter had rocks thrown at her at the playground and no one was paying attention. My daughter cried and begged not to go back. Today while my grandmother dropped her off she witnessed NO ONE paying attention while another child hit another child and tries to knocked them down. Unless you want your child bullied while the workers aren't paying any attention, DO NOT SEND YOUR CHILD HERE!!!

name: tommy behel
text: Never send ur kids to this place or any Johnsons daycare. They will bully ur child around. I, know I've been there when I was a kid, not sure if I can even sue for mental state of mind what they done to me. Specially the poor kids they love to pick on them the most. Barbara was one of them.

name: Joseph Yartins
text: Most beautiful and clean sorority house I have had the pleasure to do security work for.

name: John Rittmann
text: Decent selection of teas but the muffaletta didn't have any olives.

name: Chase Burgess
text: Would give 0 Stars if possible. Just moved back into the area and wanted to try it out with a friend and come as there guest one time to see if I like it. Get told soon as I come in with my friend they are not allowing guest until June 1st which is totally fine but the way she comes off saying it. I come back well over June 1st to try it finally and get told they had a meeting and are not doing guest for the month of June. Just wish there was a sign or woulda let me known back then. Just sad that I asked "well if I sign up right now and don't come as a guess can I use the facility" and get told yes absolutely. Just seems like a cash  grab to be honest.

name: Torri Atkins
text: Chris was awesome sauce! He was super helpful, knowledgeable, and patient!

name: Emma Klein
text: Always nice employees, but the building is very old and feels dirty. I remember going here when I was a kid, nearly 20 years ago, and nothing has changed. I prefer the downtown location even though this location is closer to my house. It is much smaller, but much nicer. Being a member of the YMCA isn't cheap so I think it is fair to have higher expectations.

name: Derek Damron
text: This is not the greatest location...... The building seems to be very out dated and neglected...... The locker rooms aren’t the cleanest.... It could be a really cool location, but the staff is super nice 👍 though ( I will say that they are 5 star ⭐️!) but it’s is very disappointing with other things that are lacked or just looked over..... I would like to see it open later and that they aren’t rushing you to get out....

name: John Traylor
text: Great place for working out and staying healthy.  Friendly staff and great equipment.  Definite asset to SE HSV.

name: John Muhlhauser
text: There's no trying this place out,  it's either join straight out of the gate or go somewhere else.  Looks like im going somewhere else.

name: Jenny Mayers
text: I workout here daily and i love the people and the atmosphere.

name: Amy Carter
text: The staff is always friendly and informative (or willing to find the answer if they don't know).  The child watch areas are clean, well-maintained, and (almost) all of the workers are happy to be there.  They have a Mom's Morning Out program that is as affordable as it is fantastic.  The equipment is kept in working order and wiped down regularly by both patrons and staff.  The family and 18+ women's locker rooms are kept clean.  The sauna and steam rooms are a nice touch after a hard workout.  Group classes can get crowded depending on their popularity but the instructors are awesome!  There are separate pools for lap, aerobics, and children-complete with multiple splash pads!  I would highly recommend this facility!

name: Dorothy Densford
text: It is always a pleasant experience to go to this YMCA. The place is clean, and the staff are friendly and helpful. It seems that others enjoy it also because smiles abound. It doesn't matter if I am working on the machines, going to yoga or water aerobics, it is totally enjoyable. I hate to miss a day. The children love the child care facility and are eager to go also. I recommend it to all ages.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review, Dorothy! We are glad that you are a Y Member :-)

name: Dana DeBardelaben
text: I love the Y, but I might be biased since I have been teaching a Spin class there for about 5 years. They have worked hard to update the look and feel of the place along with the machines/equipment. There are programs for all ages. It's like a big family...a workout family!

name: Deanna Patterson
text: I love the southeast Y!!! The child care has been wonderful! My toddler cry's when she's away from me and now she walks in with a smile on her face and runs around!!!! Her baby sister loves the baby side as well!!! Love the classes and the gym! I've gained so much confidence about myself and how to actually workout since joining in on the classes!!!  Couldn't ask for a better place to hangout with my family 😀

name: Kendall Vining
text: Great family atmosphere. Newer cardio equipment. Constantly adding new equipment. Great for people wanting to get into working out and more experienced people.

name: alicia lund
text: Their after school program is horrible. Their councilors are more concerned with being on their cell phones and eating than actually paying attention to the children for a total of 3 hours. They left my child by herself on a soccer field, thank goodness she had her cellphone and could call me. I am appalled that this is acceptable behavior to their program director.

resp.text: Dear Alicia, I'm glad that we had the opportunity to talk today about your concerns with our Afterschool program. The safety of children in our care is of utmost importance to the Y. I do thank you for bringing your concerns to our attention. Our counselor should have ensured that your daughter was delivered to her soccer coach, and she was not. After reviewing our security camera footage, we did find that when your daughter was walked to the soccer field, the Southeast YMCA Sports Support Staff Member was present and other children were engaged with their coaches in soccer practice at that time (4:59 p.m.), but your daughter's coach was not present. At 5:03 p.m., a counselor walked your daughter back inside to her Afterschool group. At no time during this footage did we observe counselors or sports staff on their cell phones. We have taken appropriate action with the counselor involved and are reviewing our policies and procedures with all Afterschool staff to ensure that this does not happen again. We look forward to seeing your daughter again today for Afterschool care and thank you for allowing us to continue to serve your family.  Kind regards, Bev Snellgrove, District Executive Director, Southeast Family YMCA

name: Ian Kinner
text: Clean, well-maintained facility with many offerings. It gets busy sometimes, but it's never overcrowded.

name: Kenneth Lowe
text: Both of my sons were raised in the YMCA and they turned out to be very happy children and very smart and it is a christian-based program

name: adam michaelis
text: There was not a sign up Friday when I dropped my kid off at kid care, but soon returning 2 hours later. There where 2 signs posted. One was for scabies and some other disease that was i cannot pronounce in child care. When I went to pick her up the staff tried to say the sign was there the whole time when it was not. My child was due for surgery and if I saw the sign I never would have left her. A man at the YMCA called me denying to  me that there was never any signs.

name: Frederic Wells
text: The staff is nice, but they do not maintain their equipment, and when stuff breaks down, it takes forever to get it fixed.

name: Bob Fuller
text: Been going to this Y for 9 years and 17 overall around the country - love the family atmosphere and people who enjoy what the do and do that with excellence !

name: Mildred Drinkard
text: A wonderful place to make new friends and excellent instructors as well as  great classes.

name: Melissa Brandsmeier
text: This YMCA is extremely out of date. Their weights are all different brands. Some look like they are from a garage sale. It just seems really dirty. It looks like everything is donated. Really wish they would update this YMCA.

name: Karon McGill
text: Clean, well lit, no tv on the wall, no radio coming  thru the speakers interferring with my music ir thoughts. Friendly staff. Grear teachers

name: Albie Kruer
text: Good facility, just wish it was open later. Especially the weekends.

name: Barry Owen
text: Great place just wish they were open later

name: Lynn Bridges
text: Nice people great place to bring the kids

name: Jessie Langford
text: I love the YMCA

name: James Chaney
text: Good folks... Christian environment.

resp.text: Hi James, thanks for taking the time to leave a review, and we appreciate the kind comments. See you at the Y!

name: teresa White
text: Very clean work area and the changing area is very clean.  The people are friendly and call you by name.

name: Kieran Hill
text: I love the y

name: Bert Poston
text: Great staff and facility

name: David Eckman
text: I travel, and pay extra for a nation wide membership.   I’ve been in 15-20 ymca’s in the last year and they have all been gracious and accommodating.  This one must be special, because they will not accept my membership, and will not give me any option to use their facility.

resp.text: We regret that you were unable to visit our YMCA facility during the pandemic.  In order to protect our staff and our members, we are currently welcoming guests from Baldwin and Mobile Counties of Alabama only.  We will continue to monitor updated CDC guidelines as more people are vaccinated, as rates of COVID-19 change and as additional scientific evidence becomes available.

name: Recep Kuru
text: Good and friendly employees but they need to check some disgusting customers. The guy spit at floor in sauna like an animal when he did chewing a gum , I already reported him and they known him . I believe they kicked him out .

name: Ernest Kelly
text: Love Gina's Total Body Challenges classes at Bounds Family YMCA. I've been taking her classes for over a year now and am happy to say I look forward to them every week. It's always fun, high energy and you get a great workout! Gina's the best!

name: Karim Harzallaoui
text: Great gym, but if they would open at least at 14:30 would be awesome

name: Cody White
text: Clean facility, lots of options, and Karen is the absolute best up front!!

name: Wesley Williams
text: Really nice gym but it has the worst hours of any gym I've been to.

name: Local Guide
text: Great customer service and welcome desk. 2 pools one indoor and heated another outdoors. Exercise equipment. Several Stories. Family environment and safe. Child Care. Excellent facility.

name: A Boyd
text: I came in as a guest with my sister who is a member. Wanted to get a membership but wanted to try a class out first. We called the day before and asked what all we needed to bring for me to do a class with her. Was told all we needed was $10. I get there with $10 in cash and then I’m told “oh we don’t accept cash” which of course was not told to me on the phone. But it was fine my sister asked if she could just charge it to the card on file. Then she asks for my drivers license that I don’t have with me because I was never told that I needed to have it. All the while I’m trying to remain calm even though this is very annoying because I did everything right and called the night before and asked what I needed to have and NONE of this was mentioned. The woman at the front desk was extremely rude and said “well your sister is a member and should have known what you needed to have.” My sister has never brought a guest before and again WE CALLED AND ASKED and were not told any of this. It was very disgusting and embarrassing the way the woman was talking to us. Needless to say, I’m not getting a membership there anymore. This was very disappointing.

name: Rachel Tucker
text: The group fitness instructors are an exceptional team. They’re all phenomenal teachers and community builders. For me, they’ve made the difference in my experience at this YMCA. Otherwise, it’s a beautifully maintained facility. The mission of the organization and the way it’s run make membership well worth it.

name: The Connor and Jacob Channel
text: Pretty decent gym. Friendly atmosphere most of the time.  Lots of machines although it seems many of the treadmills have glitchy TVs. Wish the pool was open later on weekends and cleaner...especially the outside pool. Pool staff has been unwelcoming in the past. I know they are mostly kids but they should probably have some training in how to treat the kids they are watching. We've always liked the private swimming lessons experience and those instructors have always been excellent. We used to love the Kids Night Out program, but they've made it less conducive for our child who is not into socializing. I wish they had some kind of classes for beginners especially yoga. Administrative people are nice but don't seem to be on the same page with information. Cleaning attendants are friendly and always hard at work. Now that my children are 8 and 11 they do not feel comfortable going in the ladies dressing room which I totally agree with but I do not feel comfortable letting them go in the men's area because there is no privacy for them. I'm not comfortable with them being exposed to naked men or having to expose themselves. Probably a lot to ask for a kids dressing area or family room. There is a changing room/storage room by the pool but I think it's really just meant for storage. It would be great if they would post the status of the pool on Facebook or via text. It's kind of inconvenient to get there only to discover it is closed because of a distant rumble.

name: Yosef Aborady
text: They have horrible hours of operation. Wi-Fi coverage is so spotty and when you do have a connection it’s super slow there’s no cellular signal because it is a metal building. Staff are clueless and who doesn’t open until one on Sunday it’s absolutely ridiculous. My advice to anyone would be to go to planet fitness for the same type of atmosphere half the price only thing you’re missing out on is a pool.

name: James Spivey
text: Probably the best overall fitness facility in Baldwin county. I’ve tried several other gyms and nothing really compares to the selection of equipment. The staff is also very friendly and helpful! I thoroughly enjoy lifting and swimming here.

name: Jessica Ellis
text: Love the staff and instructors!

name: Erin Adkinson
text: Great selection of classes. Large and clean facility!

name: Ash ton
text: Very military friendly! If you're active military visiting the area, they will give you a free pass for the time you're here. I'd recommend this facility to anyone.

name: Adam Manning
text: Great facility and friendly staff.

name: CHARLES Harris
text: Awesome place to work out . stay fit. I love it , family fitness center.

name: Jessica Redditt
text: I use this gym as a visitor and have been very pleased with my experience. Both the staff and other patrons were friendly and helpful to this out-of-towner. I follow a pretty extensive powerlifting and body building program and this gym had almost everything I needed, including a weightlifting platform! I highly recommend!

name: Virtual KRMZEN
text: Amazing place to go and work out or just relax in the hottub or swim in the pool! Amazing staff members that are very nice! It's very clean! It's very big and has a lot of room! They have very clean equipment!

name: Jim g
text: Great place, much better than downtown. I wish they would post a sign at the entrance and then enforce 10 minutes maximum per machine, no checking emails and texting while lounging on the equipment, chatting and socializing, rather than actually using the weights. The weights are for everyone's use, and using them is what they should be doing. Check your emails, text, and take calls in the lobby area. Thanks for a great place to work out. More fans would be a plus.

name: Zachary Dinkins
text: One of the better gyms I've ever lifted at. Nice people there too. I never had a problem with them

name: Robert Holyfield
text: Seen worse. Very crowded

name: Troy White
text: Probably the dirtiest most disgusting gym I have ever been to. My high school locker room smelled better. I don’t think the men’s restrooms have ever been mopped or disinfected. I only see the attendant using a broom and dust pan to cleanup. Wiping off equipment is not enforced. I find all sorts of goodies in the pool (band-aids, lettuce 🤷‍♂️). My wife and I had to say goodbye to our long term membership a few months ago as we just can’t justify the cost of membership vs the amenities. AND the fear of staphylococcus or MRSA. I don’t know how they stay open from a health code standard.

name: Brian Brey
text: the people are great but the facility is not up to date. The people running scheduling the classes do a poor job to say the least. the instructors that run the classes are great.

name: Rob Whitsett
text: Great gym. Needs to have more maintenance performed on the equipment!!!

name: Betsy Smith
text: Friendly atmosphere, helpful staff, variety of classes.

name: Trina Swan
text: Plenty of equipment, no parking available during peak hours. Swimming pool is alway inaccessible due to swim leagues. Open for only a short time on weekends.

name: Bert Waller
text: Nice, large facilities and decent selection.

name: Paul Klutes
text: Okay gym, some good instructors, awful christian music, and a constant stream of Fox News.

name: Marissa Ann
text: really needs to stay open till 10 pm

name: Trent McManus
text: Needs to stay open until 10 pm everyday. Needs to get EzH20 water fountains with bottle fillers. Filling a water bottle with a standard water fountain takes ages and doesn't allow you to fill it all the way up because of the angle.

name: Laylani Larry
text: I love this camp soooo sooo much!!! Me and my sister can´t stop talking about it till now! We hoped coming this summer but the stuff going on is really much. Again, we really hoped coming and being there for the summer again and seeing our already known friends and making new friends. The picture that I put is me and my sister coming from camp last year. Camp Cosby is important to me because of how much love that goes around and the songs that we share with each other to make us feel comfortable. We love every single counselor there. The director Karen, thank you so much! This really goes for everyone and the guy director, I can´t really remember his and other names right now sorry! I´m really looking forward to this illness that´s going around to wear off so that me and my sister could be able to come there! Food, perfect! Counselors, Staff, Director´s, Everyone, Awesome! Cabin mates, Great! Most of all Activities, Amazing! Fun! Awesome! Outstanding! every good describing work out there!! Everything is the best! No bad reports on this camp! This camp is now my second home!! My home that I would love to go to every summer! I´m going to miss the camp if any other things happen. But anyways I would love to talk more but I have work to do, Bye Bye!!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your sweet reply Laylani! We miss y'all this year and hope you will be back soon!

name: Greg Pharo
text: Both of our kids really loved Camp Cosby! And I enjoyed it years ago when I was young. It's fun and well-run.

resp.text: Thank you Greg!  We are so glad the Cosby tradition continues with your family.  Hoping for many more years!

name: EB Speakman
text: We had a lot of fun at Camp Cosby and the staff are the best. It takes a lot of patience to work with kids and show them what it is like to experience nature.

name: Shelbi Creel
text: I love camp! It’s so awesome! So many fun songs and Dances it’s just great! And you make friends for a lifetime!❤️❤️

resp.text: Thank you Shelbi so much for your positive feedback.  We are thrilled we were able to provide you with a great camp experience!

name: Staci Sulhoff
text: A great summer camp experience growing up!  Influenced  and changed my life in so many ways!  Beautiful setting on the lake with lots of programs and activities such as horses, skiing, tubing, minibikes, archery, arts/crafts, alpine tower, zip line, sailing, canoeing...too much to do in one week.  Plus the cabin life and activities are some of the most memorable times! Great staff that is focused on the children and making sure they are having the week of a life time.  My own children now carry on this wonderful tradition where they learn core values like respect, responsibility, honesty and caring.

name: Terri Lane Robertson
text: We had a 3-day field trip and enjoyed it thoroughly! Great staff and activities. "Camp clean" cabins and bathrooms. Highly recommend this place!

resp.text: Terri, thanks for your great feeback regarding your visit to YMCA Camp Cosby - we are thrilled your experience was a positive one, that is always our goal - we hope you are able to return one day!

name: DeLane
text: Cosby is the greatest Camping experience around!!!

resp.text: Hey Delane - We're glad you think so, and we are in complete agreement!

name: CJ Stewart
text: Camp Cosby definitely changes everyone who visits. It's my favorite place on the planet and I'd recommend it to anyone that wants an amazing place to spend their summer.

name: K9 Miso
text: Great place for kids

name: Bryant archer
text: Does bill give out jello and puts you to sleep?

name: Sydney Bloeme
text: I wouldn't be the person I am today without this place. It gave me the confidence and self esteem I was lacking as a kid.

name: jennifer nall
text: Best. Camp. Ever!

resp.text: Thanks Jennifer -  we think so too!  Glad you loved it!

name: fernando carreño
text: Best camp

resp.text: Fernando, that's great  - come back again next year!

name: Thomas Greene
text: fun with my son

name: Preston Sellers
text: I've been a camper, LIT, CIT, and Counselor and you could not find a better camp to be a part of!

name: Tracy Andrews
text: Awesome Facilities

name: Lynn Sullivan
text: It doesn't get any better than camp cosby.

name: Bratton McGregor
text: Paid for swimming lessons for my 4 year old. The instructor is great and the staff has been wonderful. However it’s 100% f ing ridiculous you have a indoor pool with glass windows around it with ZERO AC and people who keep the doors closed. It’s south Alabama it’s 88 degrees as of 6PM and it’s 80 degrees inside a room with a glass enclosure. It’s MISERABLE in the sauna that is considered a pool. I literally opened a door and was told by staff that the door needed to stay closed. If I wanted to go hang out in a spa I would have paid to go to the spa.

name: Reece Perkins
text:
Drove from Pasgogula and was turned away.
They said they were not allowing nationwide members in at this time.
Would have been nice if someone would have posted this to their website to let someone know this in advance.
Totally unacceptable.

name: Stephanie Sypsa
text: I only use the swimming pool,  and I really enjoy it. The water is the perfect temperature,  and there's always a lifeguard on duty.  Everyone that works there is super nice,  and there's lots to do to get in shape.

name: Jonathan Beasley
text: Great Staff! Guy who works the weight  in the mornings is so funny and easy to talk to as well as being super helpful whenever I have a question or need assistance! Great place to work out for all ages!

name: Keta Nicole
text: I do not ever and wouldn’t ever recommend any of these location or facilities for your children. Carmen Lee and Ashley is very unprofessional and bias. Carmen Lee through a pen at my youngest son because he was crying years back when I addressed her about she lied about it. Stay clear of this facility. She is one of the directors at Saraland short fat and stocky. Jealous is her second nature she does not need to work near kids at all. This is family Ran center and not for black children. I do not prefer sending your kids, to the after care not the ymca program.

name: Virginia Becker
text: Had a great tour and decided to join to use pool for exersize

name: Bianca Jester
text: People are always very nice and friendly. Everything is always clean.

name: 2i2never Mc
text: This location probably have the worst customer service, unfriendly front desk, email the manager the situation but never get a reply almost 2 weeks. The facility is old, needs to be updated. We decided not to go there anymore. We can deal with the facility but their service. We love the day care staff!

name: William Metzger
text:
There are 6 TV’s by the cardio equipment. The AFC championship game is on CBS. The gym closes in 90 minutes. According to the person supervising the weight room, they cannot change the channel by people’s request. Now I have to watch Fox News instead

This might be the final straw, Mobile Infirmary can’t possibly be this trash

name: Vicente D
text: I love this place

name: Lauren Thompson
text: My car was broken into while my daughter was at evening swimming classes. We were parked right next to the building under a lighted area. Lost my passenger window and belongings. YMCA should notify members of each occurrence. Park at your own risk!

name: Maria Delgado
text: Rally good place to workout with lots of activities for children to do. Their summer swim team and spring conditioning are the best with some of the best coaches in Mobile. Definitely a place for family to get healthy. They offer lifeguard and WSI certifications both done through the Red Cross. Their group exercise classes are the best!

resp.text: Thank you, Maria! We are so happy to hear you enjoy our facilities and programs we offer!

name: Michael Weak
text: Friendliest staff on the planet

name: Dorothy Sloan
text:
Very poor customer service at this location. I went in to re-join and they charged me $50 that day plus prorated for 11 days charge and then turned around 4 days later and charge me $45 for next month. Without explaining that to me.
I tried numerous times to call and cancel due to health issues and was told only one lady handled it and I would have to email her. I was told they couldn't give out her email address by one man but some lady finally did.  She never responded back via email so 4 days later after I call again and leave her a voicemail another employee sends a rude email about the cancellation and still charged me for the whole month of September. I tried to cancel 10 days before the date of my auto draft and due to their unprofessionalism I was unable to.
I will never recommend this place. Hardest ever to cancel.

name: Emilie Biggs
text: Super friendly staff!

name: Michael Pigott
text: Love a gym with a pool.

name: HM M
text: Very poor customer service. Everything involving memberships is so unorganized and neglected. The new machine equipment is difficult to use. The hours are horrible. Definitely have not felt at home there. I am choosing to go somewhere else.

name: Ishraq Hassan
text: I’ve seen 3rd world countries with better showers.

name: Trevion Johnson
text: This place is a joke ,parents do not let ur children play any sports there it's all about money they charge u $95 for a 4 or 5 game season with nothing but a shirt that cost only $7 or $8 at the most so u get 10 players on a team that's almost a $1000k .The right hand doesnt know what the left hand is doing and vice versa it is completely unorganized to the max ,if u call them out on things they dont want u there anymore

name: Samantha Pickney
text: I picked here because my kids could play in the nursery while I worked out. After five mins they come to get me to complain about my kids. They say my kids running around, playing with toys. They want my kids to sit in a chair in front of a TV. I only gone here four times and every time they had to say something bad about my kids. They hating on my kids because they being kids. My daughter is  autistic and I told them how to talk to her. They were  discriminating against my child! They would complain about my son for wanting to play with toys. These people don’t want to do their jobs. They want our kids to sit in front of the tv while they play on their phones. I am paying 75 dollars a month for them to hate on my kids! I am so not happy with how they treated my kids and me. Don’t take your family to this place.

name: Ryan Nielson
text: Awesome, except one employee who stole my basketball. Besides that I loved it there

name: Dannette Barker
text: I just found out that they now a daycare charge. As a single parent, this is upsetting.  I have never been asked to pay a daycare fee with a gym membership.  The family plan is too high and members with small children who can't use the equipment should not be charged.

name: Michele Hart
text: I love working out there. The staff is great!!

name: Jamie St. John
text: Always loved it there.  Plenty variety of exercise classes to take.

name: Ahmed Khursheed
text: I think it's the best place to do workout with how's some people locking for your kids,, I love it,,

name: overseermole
text: Great place except their day and month rates are high for a YMCA.

name: Arthur McClain
text: The staff was great, really helpful with all my needs.

name: Michael Hawthorne
text: A little pricey but you get what you pay for

name: Joseph Turner
text: Classes

name: Kelsey Finley
text: A fun place to  to be

name: rydarryian dees
text: I love this,it helps alot.
